member.name: T:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildTool
member.summary: Defines a specific configuration of a build tool registered with the build system. A build command is retrieved from a language support plugin and provides the functionality required to actually perform a particular build task such as running a compiler. The build tool defines the specific parameters to be passed to the plugin to allow a concrete invocation of the build tool to be created. For example, the plugin might define the invocation of a C# compiler but the build tool will define its actual path (allowing separate configurations for different compiler versions), or the switches to be passed (for release and debug builds). The build command defines an abstract tool definition and a build tool configuration allows it to be converted into an actual invocation for execution in the output window.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildTool.#ctor(System.String,QuickSharp.Core.DocumentType,System.String)
member.summary: Create a build tool configuration.
member.param: A unique ID representing the tool.
The document type the tool is associated with.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildTool.ToString
member.summary: Provide a 'serialized' version of the tool for saving in the persistence store.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildTool.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Convert a saved tool configuration into a build tool instance.

member.summary: Duplicate an existing build tool.

member.summary: A unique ID representing the tool.

member.summary: The document type the tool is associated with.

member.summary: The tool's display name.

member.summary: The build action the tool performs.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildTool.Path
member.summary: The path of the build tool. This can be a string template containing macros for expansion.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildTool.Args
member.summary: Arguments to be passed to the build tool. This can be a string template containing macros for expansion.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildTool.UserArgs
member.summary: Common arguments to be passed to the build tool.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildTool.LineParserName
member.summary: The name of the line parser associated with the tool.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildTool.LineParser
member.summary: A reference to an instance of the line parser associated with the tool.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildTool.BuildCommand
member.summary: A delegate to the build command provider associated with the tool.

member.name: T:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildCommandDelegate
member.summary: Retrieves a build command from a provider supplied by a language support plugin. The plugin contains the actual build functionality and provides a method to create a build command to represent this functionality. A delegate to this method is registered with the build system. When the delegate is invoked the plugin provider takes a build tool definition and source file information to creates the build command to perform the actual build task.
member.param: The build tool to be passed to the build command provider.
The source file to be passed to the build command provider.
member.returns: A BuildCommand instance created by the build command provider.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.RegisterBuildCommand(QuickSharp.Core.DocumentType,System.String,QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildCommandDelegate)
member.summary: Register a build command provider with the build tool system. A language support plugin defines a provider method to create a build command; the build command contains a concrete invocation of a build tool for execution by the output window. The provider is represented by a BuildCommandDelegate which is associated with a document type and build action.
member.param: A build action (e.g. compile or run).

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.GetBuildCommand(QuickSharp.Core.DocumentType,System.String)
member.summary: Get the currently active build command provider for a document type and build action combination. Returns null if nothing is available.
member.param: A build action (e.g. compile or run).

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.UpdateTools(QuickSharp.Core.DocumentType)
member.summary: Finalize the build tools registered by a plugin. This must be called whenever additional tools are added to the build tool system and is required to populate the tool definitions with additional data not stored in the saved definitions (e.g. line parser instances).
member.param: The document type of the tools being registered.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.RegisterLineParser(System.String,QuickSharp.Core.DocumentType,System.String,QuickSharp.Output.IOutputLineParser)
member.summary: Register an output line parser with the build tool system. Output line parsers are used to extract information from the output of build tools such as compilers. They provide file and line number information for displaying error messages and locating error lines in the text editor.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.GetLineParser(System.String)
member.summary: Get a line parser from its display name.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.GetLineParsers(QuickSharp.Core.DocumentType,System.String)
member.summary: Get the display names of the line parsers registered for a document type/build action combination. Used to present the parsers for selection in the build tool configuration form.
member.returns: A list of parser display names.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.GetAvailableDocumentTypes
member.summary: Get a list of the document types for which build command providers have been registered.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.GetAvailableActions(QuickSharp.Core.DocumentType)
member.summary: Get a list of the build actions for which build command providers have been registered for a particular document type.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.LoadSettings
member.summary: Load general settings from the session persistence store.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.SaveSettings
member.summary: Save general settings to the session persistence store.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.LoadTools
member.summary: Load the registered build tools from the session persistence store.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.SaveTools
member.summary: Save the registered build tools to the session persistence store.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.LoadPinnedFiles
member.summary: Load the list of pinned files from the session persistence store.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.SavePinnedFiles
member.summary: Save the list of pinned files to the session persistence store.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.ExpandGenericMacros(System.String,QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildTool,System.String,System.IO.FileInfo,System.IO.FileInfo)
member.summary: Expand a build tool template string by translating macro definitions into their actual values.
member.param: The build tool it belongs to.
The source code on which the build tool is being invoked.
The name of the source file on which the build tool is being invoked.
The name of the output file of the build tool.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.GetDependencies(System.String)
member.summary: Extract a source file's dependencies from the embedded options in the source text.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.GetRuntimeOptions(System.String)
member.summary: Extract the runtime arguments from the embedded options in the source text.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.GetCompilerOptions(System.String)
member.summary: Extract the compiler options from the embedded options in the source text.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.GetActionCommands(System.String)
member.summary: Get the build commands from the embedded options in the source text.
member.returns: A dictionary of command types and instances of each (e.g. a set of DoPreCompile commands, a set of DoPostCompile commands and so on).

member.name: P:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.BuildTools
member.summary: The build tools registered with the build tool system.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.BuildTools.BuildToolManager.PinnedFiles
member.summary: The pinned files currently recognised by the build tool system.
